DB DESCRIPTION: Short name of the tokamak that supplied the data
IDS DESCRIPTION: Name of the experimental device to which this data is related

DB DESCRIPTION: Tokamak ID number
Divertor configuration
IDS DESCRIPTION: Name of the divertor

DB DESCRIPTION: Date of the most recent update for any variable listed in the database
DOUBTS/REMARKS: we keep trace of creation date byt not of last modif date

DB DESCRIPTION: Date where the shot was taken
IDS DESCRIPTION: Date and time (UTC) at which the pulse started on the experiment, expressed in a human readable form (ISO 8601) : the format of the string shall be : YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. Example : 2020-07-24T14:19:00Z
DOUBTS/REMARKS: only reasonable choice, though no time; date can be converted, standard hour in the day can be decided when not available. PUT MIDNIGHT FOR TIME (00:00:00)

DB DESCRIPTION: Discharge number (shot) from which the data were taken
IDS DESCRIPTION: Pulse number

DB DESCRIPTION: Time during the shot at which the data were taken
Integer equivalent of TIME
DOUBTS/REMARKS: derived from TIME, so not useful

DB DESCRIPTION: Start of main time average window
IDS DESCRIPTION: In case the time-dependent quantities of this IDS are averaged over a time interval, this node is the width of this time interval (empty otherwise). By convention, the time interval starts at time-time_width and ends at time.

DB DESCRIPTION: End of main time average window
IDS DESCRIPTION: Generic time {dynamic} [s]

DB DESCRIPTION: Type of auxiliary heating

DB DESCRIPTION: Phase of the discharge at TIME

DB DESCRIPTION: Flag indicating whether the data point is in a hybrid mode
Flag indicating whether the data point has an internal transport barrier

DB DESCRIPTION: Flag describing type of ITB
Flag describing type of ELMs

IDS DESCRIPTION: ELMs frequency [Hz]

IDS DESCRIPTION: Chemical formula of the evaporated material or gas used to cover the vaccum vessel wall. NONE for no evaporation.
TRANSFORMATION: {'NONE':'No evaporation', 'BOR':'Boron', 'BO':'Boron', 'BOROA':'Boron (B2H6 + CH4 + H2)', 'BOROB':'Boron (B2H6 + H2)', 'BOROC':'Boron', 'BOROX':'Boron', 'B2D6':'Boron', 'CARB':'Carbon', 'CARBH':'Carbon (CH4 + D2)', 'CARBORANE':'Orto-carborane (C2B10H12) into He glow', 'DECABORA':'Decaborane (B10H14)', 'TI':'Titanium', 'BE':'Beryllium', 'SILICON':'Silicon', 'SID4':'Silicon'}[DBVAR['EVAP']]

Plasma current
IDS DESCRIPTION: Total plasma current (toroidal component). Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above.

DB DESCRIPTION: Loop voltage at the plasma boundary
IDS DESCRIPTION: LCFS loop voltage (positive value drives positive ohmic current that flows anti-clockwise when viewed from above)

DB DESCRIPTION: Plasma safety factor at the 95% poloidal flux surface
IDS DESCRIPTION: q at the 95% poloidal flux surface (IMAS uses COCOS=11: only positive when toroidal current and magnetic field are in same direction)

DB DESCRIPTION: Magnetic shear at the 95% poloidal flux surface
Represents ??i+0.5??i, where ??i is the Shafranov ?? and ??i the internal inductance
IDS DESCRIPTION: Internal inductance. The li_3 definition is used, i.e. li_3 = 2/R0/mu0^2/Ip^2 * int(Bp^2 dV).

DB DESCRIPTION: ?? Shafranov
IDS DESCRIPTION: (click to see full definition) Internal inductance as determined by an equilibrium reconstruction code. Use this only when the li node above is used for another estimation method and there is a need to store a second value of li (determined by an equilibrium reconstruction code). The li_3 definition is used, i.e. li_3 = 2/R0/mu0^2/Ip^2 * int(Bp^2 dV).

DB DESCRIPTION: Poloidal ??
IDS DESCRIPTION: Poloidal beta estimated from the pressure determined by an equilibrium reconstruction code. Defined as betap = 4 int(p dV) / [R_0 * mu_0 * Ip^2]

DB DESCRIPTION: Toroidal ??
IDS DESCRIPTION: Toroidal beta, using the pressure determined by an equilibrium reconstruction code

DB DESCRIPTION: Poloidal diamagnetic ??
Offset during the Ohmic phase between MHD and diamagnetic quantities
